Package com.cafean.client.analysis

Class ViewComponent

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.cafean.client.analysis.GenericObject
      • com.cafean.client.analysis.AbstractComponent
        • com.cafean.client.analysis.ViewComponent
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Checkable, ComponentElement, IdentHolder, ModelElement, PropertyController, java.lang.Cloneable, javax.swing.undo.StateEditable
    public class ViewComponent
extends AbstractComponent
implements PropertyController
    The ViewComponent is an AbstractComponent that represents a drawing inside the ModelEditor. This contains all of the information needed to create a new DrawnView from data stored in a local file. It also contains the picture that is associated with a given view, and gets displayed when it is rendered inside a DrawnView.

      • clone

        public java.lang.Object clone()
        this clone method copies all primitive data types. it will only need to be overridden if inherited classes contain objects which need to be copied. This should not be used for copy/paste as it initializes contained DrawnComponents and thus breaks the subclass copy() methods.
        Overrides:
        clone in class AbstractComponent
        See Also:
        Object.clone()

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        ViewComponents use their name as their to-string, as opposed to including "View CCnumber" before their name.
        Overrides:

        Returns:

      • layoutView

        public void layoutView()

      • buildView

        public void buildView()
        This initializes a new DrawnView based on a View Component. Since this does not set the view visible, functions can be called on the view before it is displayed. This is used to speed up generating a new view of components.

      • addPibBlock

        public void addPibBlock​(PibBlock block)
        Adds a new Pibblock to this View Component. While loading a sam file drawing records are added to the ViewComponent without translating them at all.

      • store

        public boolean store​(PibFile file)
        Writes this view and it's contents to the given PibFile. May call storeViewComponent(com.cafean.client.analysis.ViewComponent) to create pib blocks for components that are not part of the core ModelEditor distribution.
        Parameters:
        file - the PibFile to write this ViewComponent to
        Returns:
        true on success; false on failure with messages printed to the message window.

      • getCanvasFontDefault

        public java.awt.Font getCanvasFontDefault()
        Returns the default canvas font as defined by the user preference "Canvas Font".
        See Also:
        MainFrame.getPrefs(), SnapPreferences.getCanvasFont()

      • getCanvasFont

        public java.awt.Font getCanvasFont()
        Returns the canvas font used by this view. If no canvas font has been specified for this view then the user preference will be returned in its stead.
        See Also:
        isCanvasFontActive(), getCanvasFontMetrics(), DrawnComponent.getCanvasFont(), SnapPreferences.getCanvasFont()

      • setCanvasFont

        public void setCanvasFont​(java.awt.Font canvasFont)
        Sets the font that will be used as the "Canvas Font" by this view. Note: The view canvas font is an optional property and will only be used if the corresponding active property is set to true.
        See Also:
        setCanvasFontActive(boolean)

      • getCanvasFontMetrics

        public java.awt.FontMetrics getCanvasFontMetrics()
        Returns a cached font metrics object which encapsulates information about the rendering of the canvas font font within this view. If no canvas font has been specified for this view then the cached font metrics for the "Canvas Font" user preference will be returned in its stead.
        See Also:
        getCanvasFont(), isCanvasFontActive(), SnapPreferences.getCanvasFontMetrics()

      • isCanvasFontActive

        public boolean isCanvasFontActive()
        Returns true if the "Canvas Font" override has been specified for this view.
        See Also:
        getCanvasFont(), setCanvasFontActive(boolean)

      • setCanvasFontActive

        public void setCanvasFontActive​(boolean canvasFontActive)
        Sets the "Canvas Font" override state for this view. Setting this to false will discard the cached canvas font and font metric objects.
        See Also:
        getCanvasFont()

      • isPropertyActive

        public boolean isPropertyActive​(java.lang.String propertyName)
        Description copied from interface: PropertyController
        Returns false if this object has a property with the given name that is considered inactive; otherwise true.

        The active active state of a property is separate from its enabled state to allow for optional properties that are actually a boolean paired with a property (i.e. value) of another type.

        Specified by:
        isPropertyActive in interface PropertyController
        Parameters:
        propertyName - a String containing the name of the property to check
        Returns:
        false if the property is inactive, true otherwise
        See Also:
        OptionalPropertyEditor

      • getWidthScaleFactor

        public double getWidthScaleFactor()
        Gets this view's width scale factor. This factor is intended for use in scaling the diameter or width of components that may have one dimension much larger than the other; such as a 10 meter long, 0.1 meter wide pipe.

      • setWidthScaleFactor

        public void setWidthScaleFactor​(double factor)
        Sets this view's width scale factor. This factor is intended for use in scaling the diameter or width of components that may have one dimension much larger than the other; such as a 10 meter long, 0.1 meter wide pipe.
